moves.3. a3 c5 4. Nf3 c4: i made a note to try to take out his lead pawn
moves.5. c3 Bd7 6. Nbd2 Nc6 7. e4 Qe7 8. h3 Nf: he caught me by surprise here, anticipating he could regain the queen with a knight fork
moves.19... Qxh5 20. Nxg7+ Kf7 21. Nxh5 Kg6 22: i'm down in material here, though i will be able to make it up by move 25.
moves.23. Bxh8 Rxh8: it also leaves me with a rook vs. 2 minor piece situation after 27, though this will work out to my advantage
moves.24. g3 Re8 25. Kg2 Rxe5 26. Rae1 Rxe1 27: the advantage of two minor pieces vs. a rook is he can't afford to do a direct exchange for either, so they and the pawns can guard one another
